com.ibasco.agql.core.util

Class GeneralOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibasco.agql.core.util.AbstractOptions
      • com.ibasco.agql.core.util.GeneralOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Options, Cloneable, Iterable<Map.Entry<Option<?>,Object>>

    public final class GeneralOptions
extends AbstractOptions

    A collection of global configuration Options


    Sample usage:

      ThreadPoolExecutor executor = new ThreadPoolExecutor(9, Integer.MAX_VALUE,
                                                            60L, TimeUnit.SECONDS,
                                                            new LinkedBlockingQueue<>(),
                                                            new DefaultThreadFactory("agql-query"));
  SourceQueryOptions queryOptions = SourceQueryOptions.builder() //this can be any class that implements the Options interface
                                      .option(GeneralOptions.READ_TIMEOUT, 3000)
                                      .option(GeneralOptions.THREAD_EXECUTOR_SERVICE, executor)
                                      .option(SourceQueryOptions.FAILSAFE_ENABLED, true)
                                      .build();

  SourceQueryClient client = new SourceQueryClient(queryOptions);
    Author:
    Rafael Luis Ibasco
    See Also:
    Option, OptionBuilder

      The connection timeout value

      A channel option, when enabled, allows the application to enable keep-alive packets for a socket connection.

      • POOL_ACQUIRE_MAX

        public static final Option<Integer> POOL_ACQUIRE_MAX
        Maximum number of allowed pending acquires. If the limit is reached, an exception is thrown for Channel
        See Also:
        FixedChannelPool, ChannelPoolType

      • POOL_MAX_CONNECTIONS

        public static final Option<Integer> POOL_MAX_CONNECTIONS
        Maximum number of connections to be maintained in the channel/connection pool. This option is only applicable when POOL_TYPE is set to ChannelPoolType.FIXED
        See Also:
        FixedChannelPool, ChannelPoolType

      • POOL_TYPE

        public static final Option<ChannelPoolType> POOL_TYPE
        The type of ChannelPool implementation to use (bounded or unbounded)
        See Also:
        ChannelPoolType.ADAPTIVE, ChannelPoolType.FIXED

      • CONNECTION_POOLING

        public static final Option<Boolean> CONNECTION_POOLING
        Set to true to enable channel/connection pooling

      • THREAD_EXECUTOR_SERVICE

        public static final Option<ExecutorService> THREAD_EXECUTOR_SERVICE
        A custom ExecutorService that will be used by the client. Set to null to use the global executor provided by the library which is shared across all clients by default. (Default: null)

        Note: If you provide a custom ExecutorService, then you are responsible for closing it. Only the default executor is closed automatically.

        See Also:
        Platform.getDefaultExecutor()

      • THREAD_CORE_SIZE

        public static final Option<Integer> THREAD_CORE_SIZE
        The number of threads to be used by the internal EventLoopGroup. This is usually less than or equals to the core pool size of the ExecutorService provided (Default: null).
        See Also:
        THREAD_EXECUTOR_SERVICE

      • SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOC_TYPE

        public static final Option<BufferAllocatorType> SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOC_TYPE
        The strategy for allocating netty's inbound/outbound pooled buffers. If you choose BufferAllocatorType.FIXED, make sure to also set an optimal value for the buffer size (Default is: BufferAllocatorType.FIXED)
        See Also:
        FixedRecvByteBufAllocator, AdaptiveRecvByteBufAllocator, SOCKET_ALLOC_FIXED_SIZE

      • SOCKET_ALLOC_FIXED_SIZE

        public static final Option<Integer> SOCKET_ALLOC_FIXED_SIZE
        The fixed receive buffer size to allocate during channel initialization. Please note this is only applicable if SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOC_TYPE is set to BufferAllocatorType.FIXED (Default is: 9216 bytes)
        See Also:
        FixedRecvByteBufAllocator, BufferAllocatorType, SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOC_TYPE

      • SOCKET_ALLOC_ADAPTIVE_INIT_SIZE

        public static final Option<Integer> SOCKET_ALLOC_ADAPTIVE_INIT_SIZE
        As per netty: the initial buffer size when no feed back was received. Applicable only if SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOCATOR_TYPE is set to BufferAllocatorType.ADAPTIVE. (Default is 2048 bytes)
        See Also:
        SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOC_TYPE, BufferAllocatorType

      • SOCKET_ALLOC_ADAPTIVE_MIN_SIZE

        public static final Option<Integer> SOCKET_ALLOC_ADAPTIVE_MIN_SIZE
        As per netty: the inclusive lower bound of the expected buffer size. Applicable only if SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOCATOR_TYPE is set to BufferAllocatorType.ADAPTIVE. (Default is 64 bytes)
        See Also:
        SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOC_TYPE, BufferAllocatorType

      • SOCKET_ALLOC_ADAPTIVE_MAX_SIZE

        public static final Option<Integer> SOCKET_ALLOC_ADAPTIVE_MAX_SIZE
        As per netty: the inclusive upper bound of the expected buffer size. Applicable only if SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOCATOR_TYPE is set to BufferAllocatorType.ADAPTIVE. (Default is 65536 bytes)
        See Also:
        SOCKET_RECVBUF_ALLOC_TYPE, BufferAllocatorType

      • SOCKET_SNDBUF
